unnormalised: **Inventory Forecasting Key to Navigating Supply Chain Volatility**
normalised: inventory forecasting key to navigating supply chain volatility

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – Facing increasing market fluctuations, Indian manufacturers are turning to sophisticated inventory forecasting techniques to optimize their supply chains. A recent report by IIM Bangalore highlights the critical role of accurate forecasting in reducing warehousing costs and preventing stockouts, crucial especially during peak festival seasons like Diwali.

unnormalised: "Data-driven forecasting is no longer optional, it's essential," says Dr. Priya Sharma, lead author of the IIM report. Several companies, including Tata Steel, are implementing AI-powered solutions to predict demand with greater accuracy. These systems analyze historical sales data, market trends, and even social media sentiment to anticipate future needs.

unnormalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is hosting a webinar on the topic on 28/10/2024 at 14:00 hrs IST. Experts will discuss best practices and case studies, emphasizing the importance of collaboration between manufacturers and suppliers. A pilot program in the Chennai automotive hub saw a 15% reduction in inventory holding costs after implementing a new forecasting model developed by IIT Madras. The program began testing on 10/09/2024 and preliminary results were released on 20/10/2024. This is predicted to save the participating companies several crore Rupees annually.
